intro: Dipodium fragrans var. fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant dipodium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as peace lilies and calla lilies. The plant is characterized by its striking, arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and tropical landscapes.
